reason: The text indicates emotional distress, a feeling of being unsafe ('walking on eggshells'), and social isolation. While it doesn't explicitly mention physical harm, the situation described creates a vulnerable environment that could escalate.

title: User Story: Suicide
content: "Been feeling so lost lately. Everything feels heavy. Reaching out because I don't know what else to do. Any advice on finding help?"
reason: Expresses feelings of being lost, overwhelmed, and seeking help, suggesting potential for escalation if support isn't received. The phrasing indicates emotional distress and a cry for assistance.

title: User Story: Violence
content: "Saw a fight downtown yesterday. Dude was knocked clean out. Shook me up bad. Makes you realize how fragile things are. Anyone else feel this lately?"
reason: Witnessing a violent assault, though not directly experiencing it, can be psychologically distressing and indicate a broader issue of public safety. The phrase 'Makes you realize how fragile things are' indicates distress.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw someone OD last night. Scariest thing ever. Narcan saved them, but it shook me up. Please, if you're using, have someone with you and carry Narcan. It could save a life.
reason: Witnessing an overdose is a serious event indicating potential risk to others. While Narcan was available, the situation highlights the ongoing risk of overdose in the community and the potential for future incidents without intervention.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw someone OD at the park today. Scary stuff. Glad Narcan was there. Learn how to use it, it could save a life. Anyone know where to get training?

title: User Story: Overdose

title: User Story: Violence

The request for anonymous reporting suggests fear of potential repercussions if identified.
